recipe.name: Creamy Mushroom and Spinach Orzo (Risoni) (One Pot)
recipe.description: An easy dinner for midweek all made in one pot. Super creamy but made without a single drop of cream! Nutrition grade rating of A-. Make it even more nutritious by adding more vegetables!
recipeIngredient: 1.2 lb / 600g   mushrooms (, sliced (I used button mushrooms))
1 1/2 cups / 375 ml  milk ((I used low fat))
8 oz / 250g   frozen spinach ((1 box), thawed, excess water squeezed out)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the olive oil in a large non stick pan over high heat (if you aren't using non stick, use more oil).
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the olive oil in a large non stick pan over high heat (if you aren't using non stick, use more oil).

recipeInstructions.text: Add the mushrooms and cook until softened (around 3 minutes). Remove from the pan and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the mushrooms and cook until softened (around 3 minutes). Remove from the pan and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Lower the heat to medium and melt the butter in the pan. Add garlic and onion, and sautÃ© until the onion becomes translucent - around 3 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Lower the heat to medium and melt the butter in the pan. Add garlic and onion, and sautÃ© until the onion becomes translucent - around 3 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the flour, stir it in and cook for 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the flour, stir it in and cook for 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the milk and chicken broth and use a whisk to mix the butter flour mixture into the liquid.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the milk and chicken broth and use a whisk to mix the butter flour mixture into the liquid.

recipeInstructions.text: Increase heat to medium high. Add the orzo/risoni, salt and pepper, stir once, then put a lid on (Note 2). Bring it to a simmer, then leave it to cook for around 8 to 10 minutes or until the orzo/risoni is cooked but still slightly firm, and it is still quite saucy. Note: If you have a strong stove, turn it down slightly so it just simmers).

Bring it to a simmer, then leave it to cook for around 8 to 10 minutes or until the orzo/risoni is cooked but still slightly firm, and it is still quite saucy. recipeInstructions.text: While the orzo is cooking, break up the spinach into little pieces with your fingers.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the pan from the stove. Stir through the parmesan, spinach and cooked mushrooms. Check if more salt or pepper is required.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the pan from the stove. Stir through the parmesan, spinach and cooked mushrooms. Check if more salt or pepper is required.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, garnished with more parmesan and fresh finely chopped parsley, if desired.

review.reviewBody: Just made this used silver beet from the garden and some extra broccoli and some fresh oregano and basil. Made heaps and was delicious !

I grilled some chicken breast and sliced it and then mixed it at the end for a little extra protein. I used a blend of mushrooms too. It was a very simple and easy weeknight dinner for two with about 3 small portions for meals after!  This one is a keeper.
10/10, this dish is incredible! Such a soul food, I actually forgot the parmesan!! It was still incredible. I added the flesh from a whole roast chicken and it was perfect.

Yum, had some Swiss brown mushrooms to use up, so did scale recipe back for 2 servings. I used veggies stock then cream. With lid on I did find sauce a bit runny, so took lid off and simmered a little longer. Didn't have spinach either, so for the green element added frozen peas. Which worked really well, a great quick dinner .
Absolutely phenomenal. I didnâ€™t realise that I had forgotten to add in the parmesan - it was THAT flavourful and delicious. I also made this with risotto instead of orzo. Completely obsessed

Winner winner chicken dinner!  Made for 2, used 1-1/2 c fresh spinach, scarfed down by my veggie-hesitant spouse ;)
Delicious! I used fresh kale/spinach instead of frozen spinach, and added in chilli flakes for extra flavour. It was a big hit and people went back for 3rd helpings!

I admit it: I'm a glutton. I used heavy cream with just a bit of water.

I wilted down one bunch of fresh spinach (that's all I had) and let it drain. I didn't have enough mushrooms or spinach, but by the time it was done, all I can say is . . . oh. my. goodness! One of the most tasty pastas I've eaten, let alone made, in a long time. Just decadent!

Nagi, do you have any suggestions on how to do this recipe with the sauce and pasta separate? I was thinking of cutting the milk and chicken broth by 1/2 and keeping everything else the same. My reason for wanting to do this is so I could save some for lunch the next day, and I think it would hold up better if I could just add the sauce to the pasta.

Thank you so much for a delectable recipe!
